title: Forever101
author: Forever101
content: My people abeg o, make una give me update on the best centralized exchange wey person fit dey use ooo, because this there charges fit cut person head. Una senior men for the ministry, abeg make una give us update. Make una also give us update on how to escape over charges on Centralized exchanges. Thank u in advance

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: May 13, 2023, 10:00:50 PMLast edit: May 20, 2023, 02:19:27 PM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: For no-KYC centralized exchanges: Kucoin. For KYC centralized exchanges: Bybit. Other suggestions: Binance (KYC), Huobi (no KYC), MEXC Global (no-KYC), OKX (no-KYC below $5000 in total withdrawal). To exchange bitcoin or any other crypto to naira, all the exchanges require KYC.For no fee trading, use convert if available.Altcoins fee are low on almost all exchanges, except for ether and ERC20 tokens. For bitcoin withdrawal, OKX has lower fee, but still high as those exchanges charge too much fee than needed.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: All centralized exchange uses fee but are very minimal in a way you won't noticed it that much, or possibly could be charge either during withdrawing your assets or something within the exchange. What I will advice you is that do not deposit any funds in exchange without passing their kyc because their stories changes within most especially when they noticed there is fund involved. A closed relative who made a mistake with XLM deposit memo on gate.io, sending funds from there to Binance till date they have refused to refund his XLM after Binance retuned it back from the exchange where it was originally withdrawn, Gate.io refuses to credits the xlm to reflect back to his balance till date which is about 2 weeks.What I am trying to say is that we should be very careful with all these centralized exchanges because they are there to steal people's funds.

comments.body: Quote from: Igebotz on May 16, 2023, 10:29:02 PMYou are required to complete a LV1 KYC to trade or make minimal $5k a day withdrawal on OKC. do we really have any CEX that allows trading and withdrawal without passing KYC? i doubt.I have withdrawn many time on OKX without any KYC. Also on Kucoin. Quote from: Igebotz on May 16, 2023, 10:29:02 PMSending it to noncustodial wallet could have been the worse since there is no customer support, well its boldly written if you mess up your transfer its on you and some CEX will not refund your missing fund, if you put in the incorrect memo tag  its on you and not the Exchange.You are not getting it correctly. Exchanges and other centralized sites are the ones that require memo. Not required on a noncustodial wallet. If the memo is not correct on centralized sites, like exchanges that would be a problem that will require you to contact customer care. The exchange may have rules for such issue that might lead to money loss, rules like if the amount sent is not up to certain amount. In anything like this, centralized sites are always not better than you having your private key. Some exchanges have given me problem before, but noncustodial wallet can not because it is my keys and coins, not an exchange keys.With the correct ripple address and tag, I remember when I sent ripple to my one of my exchange accounts and nothing reflected until the second day when they refund me after contacting their customer care, ripple falled that time and I lost more than 30% of my money because I wanted to withdraw to fiat. That is just one of many examples, others which I won't be able to discuss for now. Do not compare exchanges and noncustodial wallet, it is not your keys on exchanges.
